results.title: Career in retail selling. No. 8. Success story [B&W]
results.brief_description: Set in a fashion department we meet a would-be writer, Miss Barry, who has been with the store for one year. In her conversation with another sales clerk, Mimsy, she emphasizes the benefits of being familiar with the stock and with reading trade magazines to keep up on new trends. Miss Barry gets a promotion to assistant fashion buyer and Mimsy is hired. Her contact with Miss Barry convinces her that she too can have a career in retail selling.

results.title: Career girls
results.creator_credit: Simon Channing-Williams, Channel Four Television, Thin Man Films, Matrix Films and Mike Leigh
results.brief_description: Meeting at King’s Cross rail station one day, ex student housemates and friends Hannah (Katrin Cartlidge) and Annie (Lynda Steadman), are reunited after 6 years apart for a weekend of reminiscences. Initially hesitant around one another, as time progresses we are privy to their insecurities, loves and animosities, both past and present, that they shared together and apart. Annie, initially a painfully shy young woman with a noticeable skin condition has gained confidence through the years and her skin has cleared up. Hannah still has a quick tongue and will do anything to avoid the ‘psychobabble’ inflicted on her by people who attempt to understand her. Throughout the weekend they meet people who remind them of the events that have shaped their lives, awakening them to the realisation of where they’ve come from, and where they are headed to. Cast also includes Mark Benton, Kate Byers and Andy Serkis.

results.title: Career education: I want to work for your company
results.brief_description: Dispels the dilemma and frustration of the first job interview by presenting tips for approaching the first interview. Portrays the interaction between interviewer and applicant. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.
